name: ProjectLocker
tag_list: subversion, trac, bug-tracking, source-code-management, subversion-hosting, trac-hosting, enterprise-subversion, version-control, source-control, scm, software-quality, asp, software-development, programming, svn, continuous-integration
overview: ProjectLocker is a suite of hosted and managed software development tools made available in a secure fashion over the Internet. ProjectLocker offers enhanced Subversion hosting and Trac hosting to teams of software developers, with integrations to applications such as Twitter, FogBugz, Jabber, Lighthouse, and Basecamp. In addition, ProjectLocker includes a range of proprietary, value-added applications for software developers, such as Subversion Analytics (a repository reporting application), BuildLocker for continuous integration and build verification, and their Archival service for local data downloads and extracts.

milestones.description: ProjectLocker now integrates with Morph Labs
milestones.source_text:
ProjectLocker (www.projectlocker.com), the Inter-
net's leading provider of rapidly deployable advanced software quality tools, today an-
nounced an integration with Morph AppSpace to enable developers to easily deploy ap-
plications directly to the cloud.  
As Runako Godfrey, CEO of ProjectLocker, says, â€œProjectLocker was founded on the 
notion of rapid application development.  With this new integration with Morph, our 
clients now have a new tool that lets them take the next logical step in shortening their 
time to market while still building quality applications.â€  
The integration enables ProjectLocker users to quickly deploy their applications to Mor-
ph's high-quality production  environment directly from within the ProjectLocker user 
portal, without the hassles of procuring, configuring and managing the web application 
environment.  This integration now allows ProjectLocker to expand its service offering to 
encompass the deployment and management phase of the software development life 
cycle.  By providing both a managed development environment along with a managed 
deployment environment, software teams can focus even more on using best practices 
to build their software without the expense in resources and man hours of building and 
maintaining their own solutions. 
â€œThe integration of ProjectLocker to Morph AppSpace is a great benefit to anyone who 
is looking for the fastest road to market for quality built software. The integration gives 
the developer the ability to bring applications to market with the same speed and profes-
sionalism as they were able to complete the coding.â€ Says David Abramowski, CEO of 
Morph Labs. 
The initial integration, available today, enables Ruby on Rails projects to quickly deploy 
to the Morph AppSpace environment with a few simple steps.  Support for Java and 
Grails applications will follow.  Morph Labs provides a free developers account while 
production quality environments including a high availability computing environment, au-
tomated backups and 7x24 monitoring start at $31 per month.  The Morph AppSpace 
solution is built on top of the Amazon Web Services cloud computing environment in-
cluding Amazon EC2 and Amazon S3.
milestones.source_description: Deploy Rails apps directly to the web from ProjectLocker, with Morph Labs
Agile developers deliver faster when ProjectLocker teams with Rally Software
